newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Gucci says comfortable with EPS forecasts.
newsitem.headline: Gucci says comfortable with EPS forecasts.

text.p: Domenico De Sole, chief executive officer of Gucci Group N.V., said on Tuesday he was comfortable with Wall Street analysts' estimates of earnings per share (EPS) of US$3.30 for fiscal 1997.
"The last I heard, some of the analysts were coming out with approximately US$3.30 EPS for fiscal 1997. We feel reasonably comfortable with that," De Sole told Reuters after a press conference.
De Sole was in Hong Kong after formally opening two Gucci stores in China in the last two weeks.

The Italian luxury goods company posted net income per share of US$2.76 in the year to January 31, 1997, compared with US$1.68 the previous year. Revenues rose to US$880.7 million from US$500.1 million.
De Sole also told Reuters he had heard analysts were expecting top-line growth of about 25 percent this fiscal year.
"We are comfortable with that," he said.
